Entries.default: "Shh. We're not supposed to talk with anyone... Who are you, an escaped slave? I-I don't want to get in trouble."
"Make a run for it. There's a cavern in the stock room that connects to the beach."
"You're free to go. The slavers can't hurt you anymore."
"S-sure. I mean, it's n-not like we can go anywhere else."
"You're sure? W-what if it dead ends or there's spiders or we have to swim for it? I-I'm not a good swimmer."
"Is it safe for us to run? We won't be caught?"
"H-how did you manage that? The ogres, they're strong and... I've seen the taskmaster kill a man for no more than backtalking."
With a visible gulp, the freed slave signals for the others to follow her.
"There's a sailor on the beach, waiting. Her name's Seafol, and she'll row you to safety."
"You really want to stand around, talking. Now?"
"You look like a <xg>survivor</xg>, sure. I'll believe it."
"I sure hope you're not lying! Thank you, kind stranger."
"Well, w-when you put it t-that way - I really don't!"
"All r-right. Yeah. It'd be worse if we stayed here. We'll go quiet as we can."
